name: wind turbine network connection construction, 2MW, onshore | wind turbine network connection, 2MW, onshore | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/10666/documentation

This dataset represents the construction of the network connection for wind turbines with 2MW and 2.3MW capacities. This is a child dataset for Quebec based on the global dataset. ;This connection connects one turbine to the electricity network.;The main components of a network connection of a wind turbine are the cables, the transformer and the sub-station with the circuit breaker and the electricity meter inside it. According to (European Communities 2001), electricity produced with wind turbines is connected to medium voltage or high voltage systems, depending on the size of the windfarm.;;Sources:;European Communities. 2001. Wind Turbine Grid Connection and Interaction. Deutsches Windenergie-Institut /Tech-wise A/S /DM Energy, p. 7 Tab.2.1

From the transformation of pasture land to industrial site, and from the reception and treatment of building materials.

This activity ends with the decommissioning of the network connection and the treatment of the resulting materials at the end of the lifetime.

This dataset includes 
 - all main materials for the construcion of the network connection and their treatment
 - excavation of the cable trench
 - land transformation and use
  - It is assumed that all parts will hold for the lifetime of 20 years and don"t have to be replaced.

This dataset doesn"t include 
 - neither the energy use for assembly of the different wind turbine parts nor their transportation from manufacture to the construction site
 - auxiliary materials such as packaging materials or vacuum fleece.
 - any losses of materials (waste) during the processing of the different wind turbine parts
category: C:Manufacturing/28:Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c./281:Manufacture of general-purpose machinery/2811:Manufacture of engines and turbines, except aircraft, vehicle and cycle eng

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Global data used. Uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: 10 kV-cables with a total length of 1000 m per turbine are assumed to be used for the connection to the electricity network. Image: Cable trench and characteristics of the onshore cable used for the connection of the offshore wind park [Ilskov H. (2003) Offshore work on the 150 kV substation and the submarine cable. In proceedings from: Eltra Day, October 22nd, 2003, Billund, Denmark]
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
This is a child dataset for Quebec based on the global dataset. Uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly

This dataset valid for 2MW onshore wind turbine network connections is based on one single type of a 2MW onshore wind turbine (Vestas 2MW wind turbine; where Vestas held a market share of ca.20% in the wind turbine market in 2001/02 (Chataignère et al. 2003)).

[Chataignere A. and Le Boulch D. (2003) Wind Turbine Systems. Final report ECLIPSE. EDF R&D, Clamart Cedex, France.]

exchanges.description: Literature value. The excavated cable channel is assumed to have a width of 1 m and a depth of 1.4 m for a length of 1000m.

Literature value/calculated value and own assumptions. Elements of the 1000m cable (0.072 kg/m). 
The shares of cast alloy and wrought alloy aluminium in the cancelled ecoinvent v2 "aluminium production mix" dataset amounted to 32% (cast alloy) and 68% (wrought alloy) respectively. These shares have been overtaken to distribute the original amount of 72 kg aluminium.

exchanges.description:
Literature value. One element of the cable are unspecified plastics, assumed to be polyethylene (1.38 kg/m)

The original value in the given source is valid for a whole wind power plant with 8 wind turbines and therefore has to be divided by 8.

exchanges.description:
Literature value and own assumptions. Used in the cables. The conductor of the cable is made of copper with a diameter of 6.4 mm, which gives a conductor cross-section of 32.2 mm2 and a weight of 0.25 kg/m.

The original value in the given source is valid for a whole wind power plant with 8 wind turbines and therefore has to be divided by 8.
